info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 02 at 7:54PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of McDowell, northwestern Rutherford and west central Burke Counties through 830 PM EDT... At 754 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 6 miles southwest of Marion, or near Old Fort, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Marion, Old Fort, Lake James State Park, Lake James, B.R. Parkway-Craggy To Little Switzerland, Nebo, Thermal City, Pleasant Gardens, Glenwood and Sugar Hill. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until midnight EDT for western North Carolina.
